data_sources: New York Department of Environmental Conservation (NYSDEC)
New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection Fish & Wildlife
Delaware Division of Fish and Wildlife (DNREC)
metadata.notes: Regulations are subject to change. Always verify current regulations with state agencies before fishing. Some waters may have special regulations that differ from statewide rules.

new_york.agency: New York Department of Environmental Conservation (NYSDEC)

largemouth_bass.notes: Statewide regulations. Check for special regulations on specific waters.

smallmouth_bass.notes: Statewide regulations. Check for special regulations on specific waters.

walleye.notes: Fixed season opener of May 1 statewide. Some waters may have different regulations.

northern_pike.notes: Fixed season opener of May 1 statewide.

muskellunge.notes: Check specific waters for special regulations.

rainbow_trout.notes: No more than 2 fish longer than 12 inches. Stream regulations vary by location.

brown_trout.notes: No more than 2 fish longer than 12 inches. Stream regulations vary by location.

black_crappie.notes: Minimum size increased to 10 inches statewide.

white_crappie.notes: Minimum size increased to 10 inches statewide.

bluegill.notes: Daily limit reduced from 50 to 25. Some waters have 8-inch minimum with 15 fish limit.

striped_bass.notes: Non-offset circle hooks required when using bait. Check for area-specific closures.

summer_flounder.notes: Regulations may vary by region (Hudson River, NY Bight, etc.).

black_sea_bass.notes: 3 fish per day June 23-Aug 31, 6 fish per day Sept 1-Dec 31. 20% increase approved for 2026.

scup.notes: 9.5 inches from shore, 10.5 inches from boat. Special limits for party/charter boats Sept 1-Oct 31.

tautog.notes: Different regulations for Long Island Sound Region and NY Bight Region. Check current regulations.

atlantic_cod.notes: Federal waters regulations apply. Check NOAA for current status.

new_jersey.agency: New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection - Division of Fish & Wildlife

largemouth_bass.notes: All bass must be immediately returned to water during April 15-June 15 closed harvest season.

smallmouth_bass.notes: All bass must be immediately returned to water during April 15-June 15 closed harvest season.

rainbow_trout.notes: Trout season dates and limits vary by location. Check specific waters.

brown_trout.notes: Trout season dates and limits vary by location.

brook_trout.notes: Trout season dates and limits vary by location.

yellow_perch.notes: Statewide regulation. Some waters may differ.

striped_bass.slot_limit: One fish 28-38 inches OR one fish 43+ inches
striped_bass.notes: Slot limit applies. Circle hooks required when using bait.

summer_flounder.notes: 16 inches Jan 1-May 31; 17.5 inches June 1-Dec 31. Bag limit 4 fish Jan 1-May 31.

black_sea_bass.notes: Check current season dates. Regulations may change.

tautog.notes: Different bag limits for different seasons. Check current regulations.

largemouth_bass.season: Year-round; No harvest 2nd Saturday in April - 2nd Saturday in June
largemouth_bass.notes: During no-harvest season, bass must be immediately returned. No casting into spawning beds.

smallmouth_bass.season: Year-round; No harvest 2nd Saturday in April - 2nd Saturday in June
smallmouth_bass.notes: During no-harvest season, bass must be immediately returned. No casting into spawning beds.

spotted_bass.season: Year-round; No harvest 2nd Saturday in April - 2nd Saturday in June
spotted_bass.notes: Same as other black bass species.

walleye.season: January 1 - March 14; First Saturday in May - December 31
walleye.notes: Closed March 15 to day before first Saturday in May.

sauger.season: January 1 - March 14; First Saturday in May - December 31

muskellunge.notes: Statewide regulation. Some waters may have 50-inch minimum.

chain_pickerel.notes: No closed season. Check waters for specific limits.

rainbow_trout.season: Stocked waters: Jan 1-Feb 15, Day after Labor Day-Dec 31; Main season: 8 AM first Saturday in April - midnight Labor Day
rainbow_trout.notes: Combined trout limit. Special regulations on many waters.

brown_trout.season: Stocked waters: Jan 1-Feb 15, Day after Labor Day-Dec 31; Main season: 8 AM first Saturday in April - midnight Labor Day
brown_trout.notes: Combined trout limit. Special regulations on many waters.

brook_trout.season: Stocked waters: Jan 1-Feb 15, Day after Labor Day-Dec 31; Main season: 8 AM first Saturday in April - midnight Labor Day
brook_trout.notes: Combined trout limit. Special regulations on many waters.

white_perch.notes: Combined panfish limits on some waters.

black_crappie.notes: Combined panfish limits. Some waters have special regulations.

bluegill.notes: Some waters like Leaser Lake (Lehigh County) require 7-inch minimum effective Jan 1, 2026, with 20 per species/50 total panfish limit.

saltwater.note: Pennsylvania has very limited saltwater access. Most fishing is freshwater. Delaware River tidal waters may have some saltwater species - check with PFBC for specific regulations.

delaware.agency: Delaware Division of Fish and Wildlife (DNREC)

largemouth_bass.notes: Statewide regulation. Some waters may have special rules.

striped_bass.notes: Slot limit applies. Summer closure for conservation.

black_sea_bass.notes: Check current year's specific season dates.

tautog.notes: Different bag limits for different periods. Check current regulations.

largemouth_bass.notes: During closed season, catch-and-release is permitted unless otherwise posted.

smallmouth_bass.notes: Combined with largemouth bass. During closed season, catch-and-release is permitted.

rainbow_trout.notes: Combined trout limit. Put-and-take areas may differ.

brown_trout.notes: Combined trout limit. Special regulations on many streams.

brook_trout.notes: Combined trout limit. Special regulations on native trout streams.

chain_pickerel.notes: No closed season or size limits.

yellow_perch.notes: No statewide limit. Check specific waters.

white_perch.notes: No statewide limit. Check specific waters.

bluegill.notes: No statewide limits. Some waters may have special regulations.

brown_bullhead.notes: No size or season restrictions in some counties.

yellow_bullhead.notes: No size or season restrictions in some counties.

striped_bass.season: Year-round with area closures; Non-targeting closure Aug 1-31; May 16-31 in Susquehanna River/Flats/Northeast River
striped_bass.notes: 12% reduction planned for 2026. Non-offset circle hooks required with natural bait. No live eel allowed. Max 2 hooks per rod. Proposal for adjusted season in 2026.

summer_flounder.notes: Regulations may vary. Check current year specifications.

black_sea_bass.notes: Season dates vary by year. Check current regulations.

tautog.notes: Different bag limits for different periods. Overfishing concerns in some areas.

species_distribution.notes: This section indicates which species are commonly found in each state's waters.

saltwater_species: Note: Pennsylvania has minimal saltwater access. Some anadromous species in Delaware River tidal waters.

general: Regulations are subject to change throughout the year. Always check with state agencies before fishing.
Many waters have special regulations that differ from statewide rules.
Federal waters may have different regulations than state waters.
Some species are protected and cannot be harvested.
License requirements vary by state and age.
Size limits are typically total length unless otherwise specified.
Bag limits are daily limits unless otherwise specified.
Possession limits may differ from daily bag limits.
conservation: Circle hooks are required for striped bass in most states when using bait.
Handle fish carefully when practicing catch-and-release.
Keep only what you will use and follow all regulations.
Report violations to state fish and wildlife enforcement.
Be aware of fish consumption advisories due to contaminants.
seasonal_closures: Bass often have spawning closures in spring (March-June).
Trout seasons vary significantly by location and water type.
Striped bass have summer closures in some states for conservation.
Some species have winter closures to protect spawning fish.

sources_consulted: Official state fish and wildlife agency websites
data_reliability.disclaimer: This data was compiled from multiple sources and represents regulations as of February 2026. Regulations can change at any time. Always verify current regulations with the appropriate state agency before fishing. This database is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal advice.
